sen.j: 治承三年の政変（じしょうさんねんのせいへん）は治承3年（1179年）11月、平清盛が軍勢を率いて京都を制圧、後白河院政を停止した事件。
sen.e: The Jisho Sannen no Seihen was the incident where TAIRA no Kiyomori led an army to conquer Kyoto and stalled the government by Cloistered Emperor Goshirakawa in November 1179.
The Jisho Sannen no Seihen was an incident where TAIRA no Kiyomori led an army to conquer Kyoto and stalled the government by Cloistered Emperor Goshirakawa in November 1179.

The Jisho Sannen no Seihen was an incident where TAIRA no Kiyomori led an army to conquer Kyoto and stalled the government by Cloistered Emperor Goshirakawa in December (November in old lunar calendar) 1179.
sen.cmt: "November" -> "December (November in old lunar calendar)" に変更しました。

sen.j: 治承三年のクーデターともいう。
sen.e: It was also referred as the coup d'état of Jisho Sannen (Third Year of Jiho Era) (1179).

sen.j: 治承元年（1177年）の鹿ケ谷事件により後白河天皇と平清盛の関係は危機的状況となったが、この時は清盛も首謀者の藤原成親・西光の処刑と参加者の配流にとどめ、法皇自身の責任は問わなかった。
sen.e: The relation between the Goshirakawa and TAIRA no Kiyomori came into crisis due to the Shikagatani Incident in 1177, but Kiyomori limited the scale of the incident to the execution of FUJIWARA no Narichika and Saiko, who were head conspirators, and the exile of participants, and did not put the blame on the emperor at this time.

sen.j: 法皇も表面は清盛との友好関係を修復することにつとめ、両者の対立は緩和されたかに見えた。
sen.e: The cloistered emperor tried to reconcile with Kiyomori on the surface, and the opposition between both parties seemed to soften.

sen.j: 治承2年（1178年）11月、中宮・平徳子が高倉天皇の皇子を出産する。
sen.e: Empress TAIRA no Tokuko, who was the Chugu (Empress), gave birth to the imperial prince of Emperor Takakura in November 1178.
Empress TAIRA no Tokuko, who was the Chugu (Empress), gave birth to the imperial prince of Emperor Takakura in November 1178.
Empress TAIRA no Tokuko gave birth to the imperial prince of Emperor Takakura in December 1178 (November 1178 in old lunar calendar).
sen.cmt: who was the Chugu (Empress)→不要と考え削除"November 1178" -> "December 1178 (November 1178 in old lunar calendar)" に変更しました。

sen.j: 清盛は皇子を皇太子にすることを法皇に迫り12月9日、親王宣旨が下されて安徳天皇（ときひと）と命名され、15日、立太子した。
sen.e: Kiyomori demanded to make the imperial prince as the crown prince to the cloistered emperor, and Shin o senji (a letter of the order of the emperor which demanded the inauguration of crown prince) was carried out to name the imperial prince as Emperor Antoku on December 9, and he was formally installed as the Crown Prince on December 15.

Kiyomori demanded to make the imperial prince as the crown prince to the cloistered emperor, and Shin o senji (a letter of the order of the emperor which demanded the inauguration of crown prince) was carried out to name the imperial prince as Emperor Antoku on December 9, and he was formally installed as the Crown Prince on December 15.

Kiyomori demanded to make the imperial prince as the crown prince to the cloistered emperor, and Shinno senji (a letter of the order of the emperor which demanded the inauguration of crown prince) was carried out to name the imperial prince as Emperor Antoku (Tokihito) on January 14 (December 9 in old lunar calendar), and he was formally installed as the Crown Prince on January 20 (December 15 in old lunar calendar).
sen.cmt: 「（ときひと）」追記Shin o→Shinno"December 9" -> "January 14 (December 9 in old lunar calendar)"、"December 15" -> "January 20 (December 15 in old lunar calendar)" に変更しました。

sen.j: 皇太子の後見人・東宮傅（とうぐうのふ）は左大臣・藤原経宗が任じられ、春宮坊の職員には、春宮大夫・平宗盛、権大夫・花山院兼雅、亮・平重衡、権亮・平維盛と一門と親平氏公卿で固められた。
sen.e: The position of a guardian and Togu no fu (the tutor of the crown prince) was assigned to FUJIWARA no Tsunemune, who had the title of Sadaijin (Minister of the Left), and as the staff of Togubo (an administrative institution that governed the affairs associated with the Imperial Prince) was assigned to TAIRA no Munamori, who had the title of the Togu no Daibu (a chief officer of Togubo), Kasan-no-in Kanemasa, who had the title of Gonno Taifu (vice chief officer), TAIRA no Shigehira, who had the title of suke (an assistant secretary of an office)(亮), TAIRA no Koremori, who had the title of gon no suke, clan, and the court noble of Shinpei clan.
sen.cmt: 東宮坊の（）の補足は、三省堂・大辞林「東宮坊」項目の一部を訳したものです, 亮→suke (an assistant secretary of an office)(亮）[定訳不明]
sen.e: The position of guardian and Togu no fu (the tutor of the crown prince) was assigned to FUJIWARA no Tsunemune, who had the title of Sadaijin (Minister of the Left), and as the staff of Togubo (an administrative institution that governed the affairs associated with the Imperial Prince) was assigned to TAIRA no Munamori, who had the title of the Togu no Daibu (a chief officer of Togubo), Kasan-no-in Kanemasa, who had the title of Gonno Taifu (vice chief officer), TAIRA no Shigehira, who had the title of suke (an assistant secretary of an office)(亮), TAIRA no Koremori, who had the title of gon no suke, clan, and the court noble of Shinpei clan.

The position of guardian and togu-no-fu (an official in charge of education of the Crown Prince) was assigned to FUJIWARA no Tsunemune, Sadaijin (Minister of the Left), and as the staff of Togubo (Crown Prince's Quarters) was assigned to TAIRA no Munamori, Togu no Daibu (a chief officer of Togubo), Kanemasa KASANNOIN, Gonno Taifu (vice chief officer), TAIRA no Shigehira, suke (an assistant secretary of an office), TAIRA no Koremori, gon no suke (provisional assistant master), who were the Taira family and the court nobles close to the Taira clan.
sen.cmt: 東宮傅、春宮坊、亮の定訳それぞれのタイトルが「who had the title of」と全て書かれていますが、簡略化しました。 Kasan-no-in Kanemasa→Kanemasa KASANNOIN権亮の説明補足漢字削除clan, and the court noble of Shinpei clan→who were the Taira family and the court noble close to the Taira clan.

sen.j: 皇太子周辺から法皇近臣は排除され、法皇は平氏に対して不満と警戒を強めることになった。
sen.e: The close servants of cloistered emperor were removed from around the crown prince, and the cloistered emperor began to hold a disapproval and was wary of Taira Clan.

sen.j: 治承3年（1179年）3月、平重盛は病の悪化で内大臣を辞任する。
sen.e: TAIRA no Shigemori retired from the Naidaijin (Minister of the Interior) due to the worsening of his illness in March 1179.
TAIRA no Shigemori retired from the Naidaijin (Minister of the Interior) due to the worsening of his illness in March 1179.
TAIRA no Shigemori retired from the Naidaijin (Minister of the Interior) due to the worsening of his illness in April (March in old lunar calendar).
sen.cmt: March -> "April (March in old lunar calendar)" に変更しました。

sen.j: 重盛は鹿ケ谷事件で清盛に藤原成親の助命を頼んで聞き入れられず、政治への意欲を失い表舞台に出なくなっていた。
sen.e: Shigemori asked for the life of FUJIWARA no Narichika to be spared but was not heard, and he lost the interest in politics and began to not appear in the center stage of politics.
Shigemori asked for the life of FUJIWARA no Narichika to be spared but was not heard, and he lost interest in politics consequently dissapearing from the center stage of politics.
Shigemori asked for the life of FUJIWARA no Narichika to be spared but was not heard, and he lost interest in politics consequently dissapearing from the center stage of politics.

sen.j: 6月17日、清盛の娘である平盛子が死去する。
sen.e: TAIRA no Moriko, who was the daughter of Kiyomori, passed away on June 17.
TAIRA no Moriko, who was the daughter of Kiyomori, passed away on June 17.
TAIRA no Moriko, who was the daughter of Kiyomori, passed away on July 30 (June 17 in old lunar calendar).
sen.cmt: June 17 -> "July 30 (June 17 in old lunar calendar)" に変更しました。

sen.j: 盛子は夫・藤原基実の死後、摂関家領の大部分を相続していて、九条兼実は「異姓の身で藤原氏の所領を押領したので春日大明神の神罰が下った」（『玉葉』）と日記に記している。
sen.e: Moriko inherited most of the estate of Sekkan (regent) after the death of her husband, FUJIWARA no Motozane, and Kanezane KUJO mentioned in his diary, "Gyokuyo," 'Since she forcefully took away the estate of Fujiwara clan despite being someone of an opposite gender, there was a divine punishment from Kasuga Daimyojin (the Shinto deity).'

Moriko inherited most of the estate of Sekkan (regent) after the death of her husband, FUJIWARA no Motozane, and Kanezane KUJO mentioned in his diary, "Gyokuyo," 'Since she forcefully took away the estate of Fujiwara clan despite being someone of an opposite gender, there was a divine punishment from Kasuga Daimyojin (the Shinto deity).'

Moriko inherited most of the estate of Sekkan-ke (the families which produced regents) after the death of her husband, FUJIWARA no Motozane, and Kanezane KUJO mentioned in his diary, "Gyokuyo," 'Since she forcefully took away the estate of Fujiwara clan despite being someone of an opposite gender, there was a divine punishment from Kasuga Daimyojin (the Shinto deity).'

sen.j: 盛子の管理していた摂関家領は藤原基通（基実の子）もしくは、盛子が准母となっていた高倉天皇が相続すると思われていたが、法皇は白河殿倉預（くらあずかり）に近臣・藤原兼盛を任じて、事実上その所領の全てを没収してしまった。
sen.e: The estate of Sekkan managed by Moriko was thought to be handed over to FUJIWARA no Motomichi (the son of Motozane) or Emperor Takakura whom Moriko was his junbo (a woman who was given the status equivalent to the emperor's birth mother," but cloistered emperor assigned Kuraazukari (the finance of the palace of Emperor Shirawaka) to FUJIWARA no Kanemori, who was his trusted vessel, and confiscated all of the estate in reality.

The estate of Sekkan managed by Moriko was thought to be handed over to FUJIWARA no Motomichi (the son of Motozane) or Emperor Takakura whom Moriko was his junbo (a woman who was given the status equivalent to the emperor's birth mother," but cloistered emperor assigned Kuraazukari (the finance of the palace of Emperor Shirawaka) to FUJIWARA no Kanemori, who was his trusted vessel, and confiscated all of the estate in reality.

The estate of Sekkan-ke managed by Moriko was thought to be handed over to FUJIWARA no Motomichi (the son of Motozane) or Emperor Takakura whose junbo (a woman who was given the status equivalent to the emperor's birth mother) was Moriko, but the cloistered emperor assigned Shirakawa-dono Kuraazukari (the finance of the palace of Emperor Shirawaka) to FUJIWARA no Kanemori, who was his trusted vassal, and confiscated all of the estate in reality.

sen.j: 7月29日には重盛が死去するが、10月9日の除目で院近臣の藤原季能が越前守となり、仁安 (日本)元年（1166年）以来の重盛の知行国が没収されてしまう。
sen.e: Shigemori passed away on July 29, but FUJIWARA no Sueyoshi, who was the trusted vassal of the cloistered emperor, became Echizen no kami (Provisional Governor of Echizen Province) in Jimoku (the ceremony for assigning government posts other than the ministers) of October 9, and Chigyokoku (the system for providing specific imperial families, nobles, or temples to the right to carry out the affairs of the state) of Shigemori after 1166.

Shigemori passed away on July 29, but FUJIWARA no Sueyoshi, who was the trusted vassal of the cloistered emperor, became Echizen no kami (Provisional Governor of Echizen Province) in Jimoku (the ceremony for assigning government posts other than the ministers) of October 9, and Chigyokoku (the system for providing specific imperial families, nobles, or temples to the right to carry out the affairs of the state) of Shigemori after 1166.

Shigemori passed away on September 9 (July 29 in old lunar calendar), but FUJIWARA no Sueyoshi, who was the trusted vassal of the cloistered emperor, became Governor of Echizen Province in Jimoku (ceremony for appointing officials) of November 16 (October 9 in old lunar calendar), and chigyo-koku (provincial fiefdom) of Shigemori after 1166 was confiscated.
sen.cmt: 除目、知行国の定訳「越前守」を英訳のみとしました。「没収されてしまう。」追記しました。"July 29" -> "September 9 (July 29 in old lunar calendar)"、"October 9" -> "November 16 (October 9 in old lunar calendar)"

sen.j: しかも、この日の人事で関白・松殿基房の子で8歳の松殿師家が20歳の基通をさしおいて権中納言になった。
sen.e: In addition, Moroie MATSUDONO, who was the eight years old son of Motofusa MATSUDONO, who had the title of Kanpaku (Chancellor), became Gon Chunagon (a councilor ranking after dainagon and before shonagon) in place of twenty years old Motomichi from the staff reassignment of this day.

In addition, Moroie MATSUDONO, who was the eight year old son of Motofusa MATSUDONO, who possessed the title of Kanpaku (Chancellor), became Gon Chunagon (a councilor ranking after dainagon and before shonagon) in place of twenty years old Motomichi.

In addition, Moroie MATSUDONO, who was the eight year old son of Motofusa MATSUDONO, Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor), became Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state) in place of twenty years old Motomichi.
sen.cmt: 関白、権中納言の定訳who possessed the title of Kanpaku→Kanpaku

sen.j: 基房は摂関家領を奪われた上に、殿下乗合事件に巻き込まれたこともあり、反平氏勢力の急先鋒となっていた。
sen.e: Motofusa, whose Sekkan family estate was taken away in addition to being involved in Denkanoriai-jiken (Denkanoriai Incident), became the foremost leader in the anti-Taira clan force.
Motofusa, whose Sekkan family estate was taken away in addition to being involved in Denkanoriai-jiken (Denkanoriai Incident), became the foremost leader in the anti-Taira clan force.
Motofusa, whose Sekkan-ke estate was taken away in addition to being involved in the Denkanoriai Incident, became the foremost leader in the anti-Taira clan force.
sen.cmt: Sekkan family→Sekkan-keDenkanoriai-jiken 削除(Denkanoriai Incident)→the Denkanoriai Incident

sen.j: この人事は自らの娘・平寛子を基通に嫁がせ支援していた清盛の面目を潰すものだった。
sen.e: This staff reassignment was intended to destroy the reputation of Kiyomori, who made his own daughter, TAIRA no Hiroko, to marry Motomichi and supported him.
This staff reassignment was intended to destroy the reputation of Kiyomori, who made his own daughter, TAIRA no Hiroko, to marry Motomichi and supported him.

sen.j: さらに親平氏の延暦寺でも反平氏勢力が台頭して内部紛争が起こるなど、情勢は予断を許さないものになった。
sen.e: The anti-Taira clan forces gained the power in Enryaku-ji Temple of Shinpei clan and caused the civil war that it became a circumstance that it was not predictable about what would happen next.
The anti-Taira clan forces gained enough power in the Shinpei clan of the Enryaku-ji Temple to cause civil war, causing events to become unpredictable.
The anti-Taira clan forces gained enough power in the Enryaku-ji Temple, which was close to the Taira clan, to cause civil war, causing events to become unpredictable.

sen.j: 治承3年（1179年）11月14日、豊明節会の日。
sen.e: The day of Toyoakari-no-sechie (official imperial seasonal party) on November 14, 1179.
The day of Toyoakari-no-sechie (official imperial seasonal party) on November 14, 1179.
The day of Toyoakari-no-sechie (official imperial seasonal party) on December 21 (November 14 in old lunar calendar), 1179.

sen.j: 清盛は数千騎の大軍を擁して福原から上洛、八条殿に入った。
sen.e: Kiyomori lead the army of several thousand cavalry and entered Kyoto from Fukuhara and into Hachijo-dono (Hachijo Palace).
Kiyomori lead an army of several thousand cavalry and entered Kyoto from Fukuhara and into Hachijo-dono (Hachijo Palace).
Kiyomori lead an army of several thousand cavalry and entered Kyoto from Fukuhara and into Hachijo-dono (Hachijo Palace).

sen.j: 京都には軍兵が充満し、人々は何が起こるか分からず騒擾を極めた。
sen.e: Kyoto was filled with military soldiers, and people disturbed the society by committing crimes due to uncertainty about the future.
Kyoto was filled with military soldiers, and people rioted over the uncertain future.
Kyoto was filled with military soldiers, and people rioted over the uncertain future.

sen.j: 15日、基房・師家が解官され、基通が関白・内大臣・氏長者に任命された。
sen.e: Motofusa and Moroie were dismissed from their posts on 15th, and Moromichi was appointed to be the Kanpaku, Naidaijin (Great Minister of Center), and Uji no choja (regent, chieftain of the family).
Motofusa and Moroie were dismissed from their posts on 15th, and Moromichi was appointed to be the Kanpaku, Naidaijin (Great Minister of Center), and Uji no choja (regent, chieftain of the family).
Motofusa and Moroie were dismissed from their posts on 22nd (15th in old lunar calendar), and Moromichi was appointed to be the Kanpaku, Naidaijin, and Uji no choja (the head of the clan).
sen.cmt: 氏長者の定訳内大臣既出のため説明削除"15th" -> "22nd (15th in old lunar calendar)" に変更しました。

sen.j: 清盛の強硬姿勢に驚いた法皇は、静憲（信西の子）を使者として今後は政務に介入しないことを申し入れたため、一時は関白父子の解任で法皇と清盛が和解するのではないかという観測も流れた。
sen.e: The cloistered emperor surprised by the firm attitude of Kiyomori, used the Joken (the son of Shinzei) as the messenger, and said that he will not interfere with political duties from hence, and there was an interpretation that by dismissal of Kanpaku father and son from their posts made the cloistered emperor and Kiyomori to reconcile temporarily.

The cloistered emperor was surprised by the firm attitude of Kiyomori, and used the Joken (the son of Shinzei) as the messenger, and said that he would not interfere with political duties hence forwards, and it was interpreted that by the dismissal of Kanpaku father and son from their posts made the cloistered emperor and Kiyomori to reconcile temporarily.

The cloistered emperor was surprised by the firm attitude of Kiyomori, and used the Joken (the son of Shinzei) as the messenger, and said that he would not interfere with political duties hence forwards, and it was interpreted that the dismissal of Kanpaku father and son from their posts made the cloistered emperor and Kiyomori reconcile temporarily.
sen.cmt: 下から三行目のbyとその後のtoは不要と判断しました。

sen.j: しかし、16日、天台座主・覚快が罷免となり親平氏派の明雲が復帰、17日、太政大臣・藤原師長、大納言・源資賢、参議・藤原光能、大宰大弐・藤原親信、越前国守・藤原季能、大蔵卿・高階泰経、陸奥国守・藤原範季らが解官。
sen.e: However, Kakukai, who was the head priest of the Tendai sect of Buddhism was dismissed from his post on 16th and Myoun of the Shinpei clan party was reassigned, and FUJIWARA no Moronaga, who was the Prime Minister, Minamoto no Suketaka, who was the Dainagon (Major Councilor), FUJIWARA no Mitsuyoshi, who was the Sangi (Royal Advisors), FUJIWARA no Chikanobu, who had the title of Dazai no Daini (vice leader of Dazaifu), FUJIWARA no Sueyoshi, who had the title of the Echizen Kokushu (the governor of Echizen Province), TAKASHINA no Yasutsune, who had the title of Okurakyo (the chief of the Ministry of Finance in the Ritsuryo System), FUJIWARA no Norisue, who was the Mutsu Kokushu (the governor of Mutsu Province) were dismissed from their court official posts on 17th.
sen.cmt: 大宰大弐→Dazai no Daini (vice leader of Dazaifu)[定訳不明]
sen.e: However, Kakukai, who was the head priest of the Tendai sect of Buddhism was dismissed from his post on the 16th and Myoun of the Shinpei clan party was reassigned, and FUJIWARA no Moronaga, who was the Prime Minister, Minamoto no Suketaka, who was the Dainagon (Major Councilor), FUJIWARA no Mitsuyoshi, who was the Sangi (Royal Advisors), FUJIWARA no Chikanobu, who had the title of Dazai no Daini (vice leader of Dazaifu), FUJIWARA no Sueyoshi, who had the title of the Echizen Kokushu (the governor of Echizen Province), TAKASHINA no Yasutsune, who had the title of Okurakyo (the chief of the Ministry of Finance in the Ritsuryo System), FUJIWARA no Norisue, who was the Mutsu Kokushu (the governor of Mutsu Province) were dismissed from their court official posts on 17th.

However, Kakukai, who was the head priest of the Tendai sect of Buddhism was dismissed from his post on 23rd (16th in old lunar calendar) and Myoun of the pro-Taira clan party was reassigned, and FUJIWARA no Moronaga, Daijo-daijin (Grand minister of state), MINAMOTO no Suketaka, Dainagon (chief councilor of state), FUJIWARA no Mitsuyoshi, Sangi (councillor), FUJIWARA no Chikanobu, Dazai no daini (Senior Assistant Governor-General of the Dazai-fu offices), FUJIWARA no Sueyoshi, Governor of Echizen Province, TAKASHINA no Yasutsune, Okurakyo (Minister of the Treasury), FUJIWARA no Norisue, Governor of Mutsu Province were dismissed from their court official posts on 24th (17th in old lunar calendar).
sen.cmt: Shinpei clan→pro-Taira clan役職を関係代名詞を使って説明していますが、それらを削除して簡略化しました。太政大臣、大納言、参議、大宰大弐の定訳大蔵卿の説明変更Minamoto→MINAMOTO"the 16th" -> "23rd (16th in old lunar calendar)"、"17th" -> "24th (17th in old lunar calendar)"に変更しました。

sen.j: さらに平氏一門の平頼盛・平親宗、縁戚の花山院兼雅も、それぞれ右衛門督・右中弁・春宮大夫の官職を解かれた。
sen.e: Furthermore, TAIRA no Yorimori and TAIRA no Chikamune of TAIRA clan, and also their distant relative, Kasannoin Kanemasa were dismissed from their court posts of Uemon no Kami (the chief of a government office called "uemonfu"), Uchuben (one of the titles of the Grand Council of State), and Togu no Daibu.
